section.name: Using Symbolic References
section.p: Ant users will be familiar to the ${name} convention when referencing property values. This tutorial demonstrates the equivalent functionality within the Depot project defintion.

subsection.name: index.xml
subsection.p: The index file has been updated to reference an existing property and a system property in the defintion of our message property. In this case we are referencing the system property user.name and the property location in the defintion of message.
subsection.source:
<index xmlns="link:xsd:dpml/lang/dpml-module#1.0">
<project name="demo" basedir="."> <properties> <property name="location" value="New York"/> <property name="message" value="Hello for ${user.name} in ${location}"/> </properties> </project>
</index>

subsection.name: Building the project ..
subsection.pre:
$ cd central\tutorials\tooling\simple\properties $ build
------------------------------------------------------------------------- demo#SNAPSHOT -------------------------------------------------------------------------
build: [echo] Hello from mcconnell in New York
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 0 seconds
$

subsection.name: Summary
subsection.p: Symbolic references to property names may include any property defined within the project or any enclosing scope (module or index) and any system property declared by tyhe JVM.
